oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rates of Postage in the Confederate States of America
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Description of the rates of postage in the Confederate States of America from pages 58-61 of the 1862 "Confederate States Almanac." Describes the amount of postage needed for various items, distances, and locations. Features images of 58 different stamps.

The original almanac was published in 1861 in Vicksburg, Mississippi. This facsimile was published in 1895. First page states 25% of net proceeds will be donated to the Confederate Veterans Camp of Atlanta, Georgia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clarke, H. C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Postage Stamps; Printing on Postage Stamps; Portraits on Postage Stamps; Postage Stamp Design; Heraldry on Postage Stamps; Birds on Postage Stamps; Handstamps (Philately)
Postage Stamps
